section.name: Concepts
section.p: The initial idea behind the HST 2 is to create a set of components that allow developers to create web application with Hippo ECM. It's has now grown to a modular set of components that allow the web developer to create a web application based on layouts and modules.

subsection.name: Sitemap
subsection.p: The sitemap is the main controller of the HST2. This is where you can configure your URL space, attach layouts to a page and attached modules to the containers on your layout.

subsection.name: Modules
subsection.p: A webpage can contain multiple pieces of functionality on one single page. For instance a homepage that contains a list of news articles, some banners and some text. Each single element can be split up into a HST2 module. For a news module, the module will consist of 2 things:

ul.li: a template file, for intance a JSP file that renders the news content
a contentlocation, which specifies where the news content comes from

subsection.name: Layouts
subsection.p: Each page of a website or web application has it's own layout. Withing the HST2 configuration you are be able to define the layout that belongs to a certain page. Each specific layout can contain different placeholders that belong to that page(top, bottom, left, right).
